title: Sophos Anti-Virus CPIO Archive Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Sophos Anti-Virus.
The specific flaw exists in the parsing of CPIO archives. When a long non-null terminated filename is processed by veex.dll, a stack overflow occurs. Exploitation is possible leading to remote code execution running under the SYSTEM context.
addtionnal_details: Sophos has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://www.sophos.com/support/knowledgebase/article/17340.html
timeline:
2006-09-14 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2006-12-12 - Coordinated public release of advisory
